title: Could Nikola Tesla really provide free energy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Could Nikola Tesla really provide free energy? Tesla was working on wireless transmission, not “free energy”. Wardenclyffe Tower had a generator room and “Power for the entire system was to be provided by a coal fired 200 kilowatt Westinghouse alternating current industrial generator” And even the wireless transmission was a dud.

No, someone would need to build, power, and maintain the transmitter. But even if they did, it would be so little it could not even power a modern LED. But it is enough energy to detect. Which is the basis for all wireless communication, like radio, Wi-Fi, and cell phones. This  Lead to this
